This place is phenomenal. Went here on a whim after a hike and stumbled upon this gem. This might be the best Thai food I've ever had.   Ordered the Massamon Curry and the Beef Pad See Ew. Also tried the Pad Thai, Panang Curry, and the House Fried Rice. Everything was DELICIOUS. Seriously. The curry was super flavorful, the noodles were chewy and yummy, and everything had the perfect amount of heat. I'd recommend the Massamon Curry and the Pad See Ew forsure. The portions are huge too!  Definitely a little hole-in-the-wall place that serves amazing Thai food. Don't miss out on this place.

Food: $7.95 lunch special, chicken red curry (mild) with salad and it comes with an egg roll. Hubby had the chicken pad thai with soup. I thought the pad thai was just ok and I would not order it in the future, but I really enjoyed the red curry, it was similar to pagang curry which is my go-to, but they didn't have that on the lunch special.The vegetables were very fresh and crispy and the salad was a large portion with a very fresh ginger dressing.  Ambiance: Traditional, casual, but some weird quirks. Their placements belong in an Italian restaurant and the dish they used for the egg roll sauce was a shot glass with some sports team for North Carolina. Totally bizarre - like how hard is it to get a little dish? Literally no one was in there as lunch, we were the only customer for a while so I was getting worried, but as we ended our meal, the tables started to fill and they get a fair amount of to-go orders.  Service: One waitress (possibly the owner), so it may be a bit slower at times when business picks up.  Location: this is super convenient to me located in the same plaza as Kumon and Lazy Dog Grooming.   Will put this in the rotation! And would like to try dinner to experience more dishes.

Great Curry. Too bad they charge $2.50 extra for a 4oz portion of brown rice. Not a side order just subbing for white rice.Sorry not justified. Could have been five stars, and I won't be back. My bill was $13.44 for tofu and curry and rice.

I ordered the bean curd noodles and pond soup with tofu.  I'm not a vegetarian but need a break occasionally with crisp, clean food.  They really need to clean the pans and friers more often;  everything tastes like old fish.  Throwing out $30 of disgusting food.
I got delivery. Pretty good food. I also got the fresh rolls and while they were good... I gotta say I've never had strawberry slices in them before. I'll order again.
Their lunch special is legit, prices and service are excellent! My favorite place to recharge on some really good food when out running errands.

After working a full day outside at WOC, I went to Thai Thai Restaurant and was so pleasantly surprised.  I started with the Tom Kha Kai soup (which is one of my favs) - the broth was so flavorful; the mushrooms weren't overcooked, they were wonderful and the chicken was cooked perfectly.  I opted for a level 2 for spice and I could have done 4, I think.  The pad thai was amazing.  Check in with Yelp and get a Thai Iced Tea -- which was great.
This place is ok. Food takes a while to come out. Thai iced tea isn't that good and so as the pad Thai. Both lacks flavor.  Beef rad nah is on point. Very friendly staff.

5 stars for packaging in recyclable, to-go plastic containers.  Then it's just downhill from here... The Thai ice tea was way too sweet and I could hardly tasted any of the tea in the sugar drink. This was pre- mixed, so lowering the sugar was not an option. The only upside is check in on Yelp and get it for free, because it's going right down the drain.   The pad see ew had no hint of sweetness or spice and nothing but salt. The chicken breast were great, but the soy sauce level needed to be dialed back.  I did enjoy that they used Chinese broccoli, but some pieces had inedible stalk.   The average dish is about $10, I'll gladly pay more at Gaati Thai for a much more satisfying and authentic Thai meal.

Probably my 2nd favorite Thai restaurant in town. A few of my favorites are the Pad Thai, Red/Yellow Curry, and their Thai tea. The food is so flavorful and the prices are great. The lunch combos are around $6-8 and come with a choice of a salad, appetizer, and entree. Definitely worth checking out!

What is up with all the hype? It definitely was not all it was cracked out to be. First and foremost when we get there, there was hardly any customers and the server could not even greet us or get us seated? I think the menu was a bit pricy and when we got the food, it wasn't great, i would rate it at barely edible...not even worth taking it home in a doggy bag. If you are craving thai food, you are better off hauling your stomach to Pin Kaow or Archies, better atmosphere, better service, better food. Sorry... I just have to be brutally honest.
Food is delicious! Such great flavoring to the dishes. The restaurant is cutely decorated and the music playing is very relaxing and current.

Quaint, cute, quiet and  delicious . Green curry is amazing! Go low on your spice number even 4 is hot. Crispy tofu is perfection with flavorful seasoning . Lee the waitress will take great care of you and you will want to come back again and again. A must try!

Hands down the best Thai food in the valley! I worked at one of the best Thai restaurants back home on Guam so it's been quite a journey to find a place that can even begin to compare. Their curry was without a doubt delectable and after speaking with the owner it was confirmed that it's all about the coconut milk. The service was AWESOME as well! I have definitely found my go to spot for Thai food. Can't wait to try everything else on the menu. =)
